720248f-b.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Christopher Street
720248f-b.text:
(1)
Greenwich Street, Sast side Louth of Christopher And looking
southwards on Greenwich.
(2)
Greenwich Street, 'est Side and the South East corner of
Thristopher Street, looktnr Southwards on Greenwich and
showin, the United States Appraisers Stores, Occupying
blocd from 'hristopher to Barrow Streets.
(3)
Treenwich Street, East Side, North East corner and Christopher
Street, showiur Hudsor Junnel Power Pouse at 4683 on
Treenwich ltreet looking Norchwards.
P.L.Speer.
O REPRODU TI.N3.  May 5, 1941.
720248f-b.folder: Greenwich Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718799f-a.title: Manhattan: Christopher Street - Greenwich Street.
718799f-a.text:
Christopher Street, at Greenwich Street,
viewing westward, showing hhe ''El'' station built
in January 31, 1867, from a design by a Swiss draftsmam,
who was employed in Chief Engineer Courtright's office
and vho contributed this Swiss chalet design. This
photo was reproduced on page 90 of the published
volume ''Changing New York.''
June 18, 1936
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Neg No 37
Ayg.8hcr 6o8g eNc7 NT92A26HIC1i0R EERV:1~~S
718799f-a.folder: Christopher Street & Greenwich Street., Manhattan, NY

720247f-b.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Christopher Street
720247f-b.text:
Greenwich Street, north from Christopher Street. Shown are
details of the Christopher Street station and the tracks of the
old 9th Avenue Elevated Line. The photographer's vantage point
is the uptown local platform.
May 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIOS
No.I3)
A view under the Elevated Lines showing pavement condi-
tions. The generating plant on the right bears No. b83.
At the left margin is a business building numbered 692.
This location was verified by personal observation. 9-26-40
June 2, 1937
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
720247f-b.folder: Greenwich Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718776f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Christopher Street
718776f-a.text:
(1)
Clearing, 1-7 Christopher Street at the N.W. corner of Greenwich
Avenue (right). A new apartment building is to be erected.
Nos. 1 to 7 Christopher Street and 3-13 Greenwich Avenue were
demolished for its site. No. 15 Greenwich Avenue, an old four-
story brick house, was not carefully shored up when No. 13 was
demolished, and conseguently collapsed. For some years following
its site will remain vacant.
October 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
No. 1 (1-7) Christopher Street, the completed building, beginning
ita first season, a year later, seen across the parking space
at the S.W. corner where 1-5 Greenwich Avenue and 2-6 Christopher
Street used to stand. TThe view at the right is northwest straight
up Greenwich Avenue.
October 3, 1931.
P. L. Sporr.
NO RMPRODUCTIONS.
718776f-a.folder: Greenwich Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718777f-a.title: Manhattan: Christopher Street - Greenwich Street
718777f-a.text:
11 and 13 Uhristopher Street, north side, between Greenwich
Avenue and Waverly Place, as viewed northward from Gay Street.
The set back frame structure is No. 11; No. 13 has a brick
front.
About 1900
J. J. Corell
P. L. Sperr
NOT REPRODUCTIONS
